channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: New York City's Chrysler Building is up for sale again
item.description: The Chrysler Building, a symbol of Art Deco glamor in the 1930s and once the tallest skyscraper in the world, is up for sale, again.

item.title: Doctor says many he operated on in Gaza were civilians shot while trying to reach aid
item.description: NPR speaks with a British orthopedic surgeon who just returned from his fourth medical mission to Gaza. He says many people he operated on were civilians and were shot while trying to reach food aid.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump issues travel ban on 12 countries and partial restrictions on 7 others, Senate begins work on budget bill to enact Trump agenda, the latest on U.S. talks with Iran over their nuclear program.

item.title: In 'Our Dear Friends in Moscow," Russian journalists describe a 'broken generation'
item.description: In their memoir "Our Dear Friends In Moscow," Russian journalists Andrei Soldatov and Irina Borogan explain how their friendships with others ruptured as Russia grew isolated from the West.

item.title: FBI arrests man who allegedly aided Palm Springs fertility clinic bomber
item.description: The FBI has arrested a suspected co-conspirator in last month's bombing of a fertility clinic in Palm Springs. Authorities say he supplied chemicals to the primary suspect to make explosives.

item.title: C-SPAN CEO Sam Feist to launch 'Ceasefire,' a new weekly program
item.description: NPR speaks with C-SPAN CEO Sam Feist about the channel's unfiltered coverage of government and about "Ceasefire," a new weekly program he's launching that brings lawmakers to the table.

item.title: As Senate gets to work on budget bill, some in GOP raise concerns over deficit impact
item.description: The Senate is getting to work this week on President Trump's signature domestic policy bill. But growing concerns about its projected impact on the deficit are complicating its path to passage.

item.title: With Elon Musk out of the White House, how much political power does he wield?
item.description: Elon Musk has criticized a GOP bill he says will increase the budget deficit and undermine the work he led at DOGE. But what kind of political power does he have now he's no longer a Trump adviser?

item.title: Smoke from Canadian wildfires impacting people across the Midwest
item.description: People in many parts of the Midwest have been dealing with smoke from Canadian wildfires all week. Wisconsin had the worst air quality in the country Wednesday. NPR checks in on people in Milwaukee.

item.title: China observer Robert Daly discusses U.S. plans to revoke Chinese student visas
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks with longtime China observer Robert Daly about Trump administration plans to revoke Chinese student visas amid assertions of national security concerns.
